t: A Psalm of David. A Contemplation.
Blessed*pn is*i he*i whose*i transgression is*i forgiven, Whose*ild sin is*i covered.
Blessed*ld is*i the man to whom the Lord*s does not impute iniquity, And*ld in whose spirit there*i is*i no deceit.
When*ln I kept silent, my bones grew old Through*ld my groaning all the day long.
For*ld day and night Your hand was heavy upon me; My*ld vitality was turned into the drought of summer. Selah*ipg
I*ld acknowledged my sin to You, And*ld my iniquity I have not hidden. I*ld said, “I will confess my transgressions to the Lord,”*s And*ld You forgave the iniquity of my sin. Selah*ipg
For*pn this cause everyone who is godly shall pray to You In*ld a time when You may be found; Surely*ld in a flood of great waters They*ld shall not come near him.
You*ld are*i my hiding place; You*ld shall preserve me from trouble; You*ld shall surround me with songs of deliverance. Selah*ipg
I*pn will instruct you and teach you in the way you should go; I*ld will guide you with My eye.
Do*ld not be like the horse or*i like the mule, Which*ild have no understanding, Which*ld must be harnessed with bit and bridle, Else*ld they will not come near you.
Many*ln sorrows shall*i be*i to the wicked; But*ld he who trusts in the Lord,*s mercy shall surround him.
Be*ld glad in the Lord*s and rejoice, you righteous; And*ld shout for joy, all you*i upright in heart!
